item.title: Defeating BattlEye's Dll Protection
item.description: Introduction The anti-cheat software BattlEye, considered the gold standard, has a catastrophic weakness that makes it easy for an attacker to insert code into the game’s address space. Dll injection is a well-known idea, but because of the numerous anti-cheat techniques used, attackers have resorted to manually mapping their modules into the game’s address space in order to get beyond the checks employed. Load Image Callback Several separate callbacks will initially be registered by the BattlEye driver when it is loaded into the kernel.
